Package ohos.multimodalinput.event

Class SpeechEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.multimodalinput.event.MultimodalEvent
      • ohos.multimodalinput.event.SpeechEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class SpeechEvent
extends MultimodalEvent
    Defines speech events. You can use this class to obtain the speech recognition result.

    The system offers the speech recognition capability to recognize user speeches and sends the recognition result to you as an event. This event carries such information as the recognized speech action, hot words.

    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    MultimodalEvent
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.MultimodalInput#MULTIMODAL_INPUT

    • Method Detail

      • createEvent

        public static Optional<SpeechEvent> createEvent​(long occurTime,
                                                int action,
                                                String value)
        A constructor used to create a SpeechEvent instance.
        Parameters:
        occurTime - Indicates the time when the event occurs.
        action - Indicates the action of the event. The value should be ACTION_SWITCH_ON, ACTION_SWITCH_OFF or ACTION_HIT_HOTWORD.
        value - Indicates the property value carried in action.
        Returns:
        Returns the SpeechEvent object. In a valid SpeechEvent object, the SCENE value is SCENES_PAGE and the matchmode value is MATCH_MODE_EXACT.
        Since:
        3

      • getAction

        public int getAction​()
        Obtains the action of this speech event.
        Returns:
        Returns the action of this event. The value can be ACTION_SWITCH_ON, ACTION_SWITCH_OFF or ACTION_HIT_HOTWORD.
        Since:
        3

      • getScene

        public int getScene​()
        Obtains the scene where the action is performed.
        Returns:
        Returns the scene, which can be SCENES_VIDEO, SCENES_AUDIO, SCENES_PAGE, SCENES_SWITCH or SCENES_COMMON.
        Since:
        3

      • getActionProperty

        public String getActionProperty​()
        Obtains the property value carried in action.
        Returns:
        Returns the property value carried in action.
        Since:
        3

      • getMatchMode

        public int getMatchMode​()
        Obtains the match mode for the current recognition result.
        Returns:
        Returns the match mode for the current recognition result, which can be MATCH_MODE_EXACT or MATCH_MODE_FUZZY.
        Since:
        3

      • getSourceDevice

        public int getSourceDevice​()
        Description copied from class: MultimodalEvent
        Obtains the type of the input device that generates the current event.
        Specified by:
        getSourceDevice in class MultimodalEvent
        Returns:
        Returns the type of the input device that generates the event. The return values are as follows: MultimodalEvent.UNSUPPORTED_DEVICE: no input device. Generally, this is the default value. MultimodalEvent.TOUCH_PANEL: touch panel MultimodalEvent.KEYBOARD: keyboard MultimodalEvent.MOUSE: mouse MultimodalEvent.STYLUS: stylus MultimodalEvent.BUILTIN_KEY: built-in key MultimodalEvent.ROTATION: rotation component MultimodalEvent.SPEECH: speech component

      • getDeviceId

        public String getDeviceId​()
        Description copied from class: MultimodalEvent
        Obtains the ID of the bearing device for the input device that generates the current event.

        For example, if two mouse devices are connected to the same device, this device is the bearing device of the two mouse devices.

        Specified by:
        getDeviceId in class MultimodalEvent
        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the bearing device for the input device that generates the current event; returns null if there is no input device.
        See Also:
        MultimodalEvent.getInputDeviceId()

      • getInputDeviceId

        public int getInputDeviceId​()
        Description copied from class: MultimodalEvent
        Obtains the ID of the input device that generates the current event.

        An input device is identified by a unique ID. For example, when two mouse devices generate an event respectively, the device ID in the generated events are different. This allows your application to use the device ID to identify the actual input device.

        Specified by:
        getInputDeviceId in class MultimodalEvent
        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the input device that generates the current event; returns -1 if there is no input device.
        See Also:
        MultimodalEvent.getDeviceId()

      • getOccurredTime

        public long getOccurredTime​()
        Description copied from class: MultimodalEvent
        Obtains the time when the current event is generated.
        Specified by:
        getOccurredTime in class MultimodalEvent
        Returns:
        Returns the time (in ms) when the current event is generated.
